alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Stillwater (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 24 at 3:27PM MDT until June 24 at 9:30PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Montana, including the following counties, Carbon and Stillwater. * WHEN...Until 730 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 323 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated 0.5 to 1.0 inch of rainfall has fallen along a slow moving line of showers and thunderstorms over the past hour. This is in an area that saw excessive rainfall over the past 36 hours. The ground is saturated and most of this rainfall will runoff. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This advisory includes Keyser creek in the Columbus vicinity. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbus, Halfbreed Lake Wildlife, Rapelje, Hailstone Wildlife Refuge, Park City and Silesia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move to higher ground. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places.
